dt.t: The harness strap was {it}fretting{/it} the horse.

dt: {bc}to make by wearing away a substance

dt.t: a poor player who struts and {wi}frets{/wi} his hour upon the stage

dt: {bc}to affect something as if by gnawing or biting {bc}{sx|grate||}

dt.t: the … urgent voice {it}fretted{/it} at his nerves
Marble {wi}frets{/wi} away due to the rain.
His back where the harness rubbed began to {wi}fret{/wi}.
{it}fretting{/it} over the high cost of feeding their families

et: Middle English, to devour, fret, from Old English {it}fretan{/it} to devour; akin to Old High German {it}frezzan{/it} to devour, {it}ezzan{/it} to eat {ma}{mat|eat|}{/ma}
shortdef: to eat or gnaw into : corrode; also : fray
to make by wearing away a substance
the action of wearing away : erosion

dt: {bc}to enrich with embossed or pierced carved patterns

et: Middle English, back-formation from {it}fret, fretted{/it} adorned, interwoven, from Anglo-French {it}fretté{/it}, past participle of {it}fretter{/it} to tie, probably from Vulgar Latin {it}*firmitare{/it}, from Latin {it}firmus{/it} firm
shortdef: to enrich with embossed or pierced carved patterns

dt: {bc}a medieval metallic or jeweled net for a woman's headdress
{bc}an ornament or ornamental work often in relief consisting of small straight bars intersecting one another in right or oblique angles

shortdef: an ornamental network; especially : a medieval metallic or jeweled net for a woman's headdress
an ornament or ornamental work often in relief consisting of small straight bars intersecting one another in right or oblique angles

dt: {bc}one of a series of ridges fixed across the fingerboard of a stringed musical instrument (such as a guitar)

et: perhaps from Middle French {it}frete{/it} ferrule, from {it}freter{/it}
shortdef: one of a series of ridges fixed across the fingerboard of a stringed musical instrument (such as a guitar)

dt: {bc}to press (the strings of a stringed instrument) against the {a_link|frets}

shortdef: to press (the strings of a stringed instrument) against the frets
